name: Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Downtown

reviews.text: I've stayed here several times and have hosted 2 breakfast meetings in the Ovid Butler Room. The staff is friendly and easy to work with, especially Celia for meeting planning. It's a great location for visiting downtown Indianapolis clients. My only complaint is that is takes forever to get your car when you valet. It's an issue for several downtown hotels in Indianapolis so always call 10-15 minutes ahead to have your car brought up.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotel in Downtown Indianapolis

reviews.text: Stayed here for a convention and it was a great hotel as most Hilton garden Inn's are. Walking distance to the Indianapolis Convention Center and plenty of places to eat. Rooms very clean. Staff was great and helpful. Also Valet parking.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.text: Wow. Superb service, location, price, cleanliness, quietness. Couldn't have asked for a better experience.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed for one night and felt this was an excellent experience.
reviews.title: Great value! Excellent property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free wifi, easy access to late night snack, located near multiple family friendly restaurants.
reviews.title: Love the old buildings

reviews.text: I stayed here for four nights on business. Rock hard bed, my room smelled of cigarettes, the ac couldn't keep up, the room was humid and dank, and I ate something in the restaurant that had me sick for three days. Yuck.
reviews.title: Won't stay here again unless I have to.

reviews.text: I returned to the HGI Indianapolis Downtown for the 4th or 5th time when attending the Indianapolis 500. It was my favorite place to stay for the race. However, this year I was really disappointed with the experience. To start, I was given a really compact room upon arrival. One of the things I recall fondly was the large rooms and even getting a HHonors Diamond upgrade during my stays. This time I was not even acknowledged as a Diamond member and then had to complain to get moved to a larger room. Unfortunately, the room was also showing signs of age and need of renovation. I had a room with two beds and the bed I had was terribly uncomfortable. I stay at HGI often but the adjustable bed I had was not working properly and was like sleeping in a large bowl. Add to that the issue that the HVAC was not working properly and the only way to keep the room even slightly cool was to keep it running 24/7 and keeping the windows covered the entire stay. The result was also a dampness to our clothing and a loud hum of a barely working AC the entire stay. We also needed a refrigerator. Well, the one in our room was also barely cooling. I twice stopped by the front desk upon leaving the hotel and asked for someone to PLEASE look at the situation with HVAC and Fridge. I was assured they would. Well, to the best of my knowledge, nobody ever stopped by. I did not receive the ususal courtesy call/message and it was obvious neither issue was resolved. Bottom line is that I cannot recommend this hotel any longer until they begin to address issues of an aging hotel.
reviews.title: Used to LOVE this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last note, the valet parking attendant was extremely rude when we needed his assistance when we found the self parking garage was closed for Memorial Day. What was up with that.? Also, the self parking attendant was also unbelievably rude. We had the appropriate parking pass from the fornt desk but he did not want to let us out of the garage since we did not have the original ticket (front desk took it in exchange for the red parking badge). He was furious and wanted me to call teh front desk to resolved. Since the hotel partners are a reflection of the hotel itself, I cannot just brush it off as being th eparking garage or the valet parking company. It is another issue on the list the contributed tomy dissatisfaction with the HGI Indy.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Indy!

reviews.text: As I said, it was always my choice when in Indy, but now I will stay at another Hilton property for the 2012 race.
reviews.title: Nice place, kids enjoyed the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay in downtown Indy. The queen suites are huge and quite a value for the space and location. Hotel is just off the circle and within walking distance to a variety of attractions and restaurants. I've stayed there twice and haven't been disappointed.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Indy for a getaway weekend and a concert. The hotel was in the center of downtown and very short walking distance from shopping, restaurants, night clubs and sporting venues. The hotel is located steps away from the historic Monument Circle, and close to the river walk and the new 9/11 exhibit. Hotel staff were very nice, and their restuarant recommendation was spot on. Hotel rooms were average size and very clean but the lobby has the look of an older hotel. Hotel bar is nothing special. Valet parking is not necessary as there is a parking deck literally across the street for $9 per day. Perfect location if you are headed to downtown Indy !
reviews.title: Perfect !

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference in July. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I usually stay at Marriott but all Marriott properties were sold out and they (Marriott) doubled their prices for this busy weekend in Indianapolis. I called this property and got a very large double room for a great price. The location was wonderful and I will defiantly stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I've stayed in downtown Indy several times and was excited to try this property. I'm so glad I did! The elegant lobby and friendly staff immediately made me feel at home. The location was exceptional: just steps away from Monument Circle with dozens of restaurants in the surrounding blocks.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel, Prime Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a minor maintenance issue that they addressed lightning fast (less than 10 minutes after I called there was a knock on my door).
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.text: I forgot to ask about the history of the building--I'm guessing it must have been an historic hotel that was extensively renovated to meet Hilton Garden Inn's high standards.
reviews.title: Helpful staff. Nice enough hotel

reviews.text: Overall this is a great hotel walking distance to everything in Downtown. The staff was very attentative and friendly in assisting us. My only complain is the beds are hard and lumpy and the the hot water when taking a shower was not consistent. We were told the hotel was older and used steam for the plumbing so it caused the noises we heard and reason for inconsistent water temperature. If you do not mind the latter, this a good hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location! Friendly Staff! Hard Beds!

reviews.text: A gem in downtown Indianapolis
reviews.title: A Fantastic HGI

reviews.text: What a great find!!! This is a renovated historic building from 1916 (Wikepdia) in the heart of downtown Indy. It was once a bank (Fletcher Savings and Trust) and still shows a lot of the ambience from that by gone era. Everything is here and within walking distance, including Lucas Oil Stadium. I had a spacious room on the 14th floor that offered a great view of the downtown skyline. As with all HGI’s the standards are above average with a very personal and attentive staff. To me this experience was totally positive,and I would have no hesitation staying at this property again, or recommending it to anyone. A+++++
reviews.title: Very decent stay

reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Helpful front desk staff. Terrific downtown location.Easy walk to convention center. Very large room. Accessible outlets - nice that some hotels have figured this out. TV had a wide swivel range - it's the little things that make a stay so much easier. Neutrogena bath products. i would stay here again.
reviews.title: Always nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel for the price. Nothing spectacular as far as views go, but great service and very clean.
reviews.title: Very Accommodating!

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Downtown Hotel
description: Luxury and value combine in this historic building in downtown Indianapolis. Oversized guest rooms with picture windows, refrigerators, microwaves and complimentary Wi-Fi ensure a comfortable and convenient stay experience.
